meanings.definition: relating to or in accordance with Jewish law
meanings.sent1: The halakhic teachings guide the Jewish community in following religious laws.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi provided a halakhic interpretation of the scripture.
meanings.sent3: The halakhic debate over dietary restrictions led to some funny misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her actions were a halakhic reflection of her deep faith.
meanings.sent5: The halakhic principles were deeply ingrained in their cultural practices.

meanings.definition: a legal ruling or decision based on Jewish law
meanings.sent1: The halakhic determined the proper course of action in the dispute.
meanings.sent2: The court issued a halakhic regarding the inheritance case.
meanings.sent3: The halakhic seemed to have a mind of its own, always surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His words carried the weight of a halakhic, influencing the entire congregation.
meanings.sent5: The halakhic was a beacon of clarity in the complex legal matters.
